com.inqwell.any.beans

Interface ListenerAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable

    public interface ListenerAdapter
extends Any
    This interface describes the expected usage for any adapter class which converts third party java events (eg AWT) to the Any environment.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Any eventCategory()
      One listener adapter might be capable of handling multiple events (e.g.

      void notifyAdaptee(Event e)
      Pass an INQ event, possibly wrapping an external event, to the registered adaptee
      void setAdaptee(ListenerAdaptee l)

      • Methods inherited from interface com.inqwell.any.Any

        accept, bestowConstness, buildNew, cloneAny, copyFrom, createIterator, isConst, isTransactional

    • Method Detail

      • notifyAdaptee

        void notifyAdaptee(Event e)
        Pass an INQ event, possibly wrapping an external event, to the registered adaptee

      • setAdaptee

        void setAdaptee(ListenerAdaptee l)
        Set the adaptee we will notify

      • isSupported

        boolean isSupported(Any eventType)
        Check if this adapter supports the given event type. Some adapters will only handle a single event (such as action) while others will support more than one. Specifically, this happens where Java defines adapter classes with multiple methods for event sources to call on their listeners.

      • eventCategory

        Any eventCategory()
        One listener adapter might be capable of handling multiple events (e.g. the WindowListener interface). Return the name of event group this listener is responsible for (e.g. "window".

      • hasInterest

        void hasInterest(Any eventType)
        If the ListsnerAdaptee has an interest in the specified event it should call this method to let the ListenerAdapter know. This gives the adapter a chance to perform optimisation on the processing of the various types of events it receives before calling the adaptee

      • hasNoInterest

        void hasNoInterest(Any eventType)
        Similar to hasInterest. Adaptee is no longer interested in this event.
